metadata.description: Prioritized list of TypeScript files for AssemblyScript/WASM conversion
metadata.sorting: Complexity score (highest first - most complex to least complex)

summary.notes: Assessment complete - 48 functions already have WASM implementations, 2 not suitable for WASM (mode requires JS hash maps, compareNatural uses external JS library)

candidates.recommendation: High-value numerical solver. Complex algorithm but pure numeric. Consider for WASM for 5-10x speedup on large systems.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/numeric/ode.ts (rk45Step, rk23Step, maxError, computeStepAdjustment, interpolate, etc.)

candidates.recommendation: Matrix inversion. Uses LU/QR. High computational complexity. Significant WASM benefit.
Good numeric reduction. Already decomposed into numeric operations. Moderate effort for significant gain.
Selection-based algorithm. Good for WASM. Requires partitionSelect conversion first.

issues: depends on eigs for spectral norm
candidates.recommendation: Multiple norm types (1, 2, inf, fro). Core numeric but complex. Partial WASM for vector norms.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/arithmetic/advanced.ts (norm1, norm2, normInf, normP) and src/wasm/matrix/linalg.ts

candidates.recommendation: Already WASM-aware. Core numeric. Flagged for conversion at 200+ element threshold.
Complex numeric algorithm. Type-dependent implementation. Partial WASM feasible for core numeric path.
QR decomposition via Householder. Significant speedup in WASM. Complex but high value.
Build after variance. Pure numeric stats operation. Benefits from WASM vectorization.

issues: uses JavaScript hash map for counting
algorithm is O(n) counting, not compute-intensive
candidates.recommendation: Not suitable for WASM - relies on JS hash maps and mixed type handling. Limited WASM benefit for counting algorithm.
candidates.notes: Could implement numeric-only version but overhead doesn't justify the limited speedup for counting operations

candidates.recommendation: Euclidean geometry core is pure numeric. Multiple branches reduce WASM benefit. Consider specialized path.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/geometry/operations.ts (distance2D, distance3D, distanceND, manhattanDistance)

candidates.recommendation: Mean absolute deviation. Pure numeric reduction. Easy conversion, good teaching case.
Stirling partition numbers. DP algorithm good for WASM. Significant speedup expected.
Pure number implementations. Gamma function approximations. Direct WASM translation ideal.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/special/functions.ts (gamma, lgamma, gammaArray, lgammaArray)

candidates.recommendation: LU with partial pivoting. Numerical algorithm good for WASM. Already complex JS.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/algebra/decomposition.ts (luDecomposition, luDecompositionSIMD) and wasm/algebra/sparseLu.ts

candidates.recommendation: Determinant via factorization. Depends on LU. High numeric load.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/matrix/linalg.ts (det with LU decomposition, optimized 2x2/3x3)

candidates.recommendation: Power function. Handles real/complex/BigNumber. Partial WASM for numeric path only.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/arithmetic/logarithmic.ts (pow, powConstantArray) and src/wasm/plain/arithmetic.ts

candidates.recommendation: Pure numeric combinatorial. Bell number DP algorithm. Clean conversion target.
Composition enumeration. Recursive structure benefits from stack efficiency in WASM.
Good cumulative operation. WASM beneficial for large arrays. Handles multi-dimensional arrays.
Pure numeric combinatorics. Clean iteration-based logic. Good WASM candidate.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/combinatorics/basic.ts (factorial, combinations, combinationsWithRep, permutations)

candidates.recommendation: GCD via Euclidean algorithm. Pure numeric iteration. Clean WASM translation.
Error function approximation. Pure numeric. Series expansion good for WASM.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/special/functions.ts (erf, erfc, erfArray, erfcArray)

candidates.recommendation: Riemann zeta approximation. Pure numeric series. Good WASM candidate.
Forward substitution solver. After LU, this benefits from WASM. Stream processing.
Backward substitution solver. Pairs with lsolve. Simple loop intensive.

issues: heavily relies on JavaScript type introspection
type dispatch logic, not numeric computation
candidates.recommendation: Not suitable for WASM - relies on JS-specific type system and external library for natural string sorting.
candidates.notes: Core numeric compare already in WASM; this is type dispatch wrapper

candidates.recommendation: Catalan number computation. Simple numeric formula. Ideal for WASM.
Already optimal. Direct Math.* calls. Low overhead, mostly for completeness.
Direct Math wrappers. Minimal benefit over native. Keep as JS fallback.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/trigonometry/basic.ts (sin, cos, tan, all trig functions)

candidates.recommendation: Simple reduction. WASM beneficial for large arrays. Vectorizable.
Simple reduction. WASM beneficial for large arrays. Vectorizable.
Product accumulation. Simple loop. Good WASM candidate for numeric paths.
Array flattening. Simple recursive descent. Minimal WASM benefit but good test case.
Direct bitwise operations. WASM natural fit. i32 operations ideal.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/bitwise/operations.ts (bitAnd, bitOr, bitXor, bitNot, shifts)

candidates.recommendation: LCM computation. Once GCD is in WASM, can wrap it for LCM.
Utility functions collection. Mixed complexity. Good intermediate targets.
candidates.notes: Core utilities implemented in src/wasm/utils/checks.ts and src/wasm/relational/operations.ts

candidates.recommendation: Diagonal matrix operations. Simple indexing. Good basic example.
Square root. Multiple branches for types. Core numeric path good for WASM.
candidates.notes: Implemented in src/wasm/arithmetic/logarithmic.ts (sqrt, sqrtArray) and src/wasm/plain/arithmetic.ts

candidates.recommendation: atan2 for 2D geometry. Direct Math wrapper but vectorizable.
Universal comparison. Type dispatch complex but numeric path simple.
Pure comparison functions. Trivial WASM conversion. Good first WASM project.
Logical operations on numbers. Simple bit/boolean logic. Minimal overhead.
Cube root. Simple transcendental. Pairs with sqrt for radical functions.
Transpose operation. Trivial algorithm but high data volume. WASM reduces overhead.
Simple type predicate. Minimal WASM benefit but useful utility.
Integer predicate. Trivial WASM conversion. Good basic example.
Sign checking. Trivial conversion. Demonstrates WASM utility functions.
Sign checking. Trivial conversion. Pairs with isNegative.
Zero predicate. Trivial conversion. Common utility function.
